The Ten Commandments (1923).title: The Ten Commandments
The Ten Commandments (1923).synopsis: After hearing the story of Moses, the two sons of a devout Christian mother go their separate ways. One brother, an atheist, breaks biblical principles.

The Gold Rush (1925).title: The Gold Rush
The Gold Rush (1925).synopsis: A lone prospector ventures into Alaska looking for gold. He gets mixed up with Big Jim and a wanted criminal. He falls in love with Georgia, a dancer.

The Phantom of the Opera (1925).title: The Phantom of the Opera
The Phantom of the Opera (1925).synopsis: At the Opera of Paris, a phantom forces a famous singer to give up her role for unknown Christine, who meets him in the catacombs where he lives.

The Strong Man (1926).title: The Strong Man
The Strong Man (1926).synopsis: During World War I, Belgian soldier Paul receives a letter and photo from Mary Brown. He travels to the U.S. to find her and somehow saves her town.

Metropolis (1927).title: Metropolis
Metropolis (1927).synopsis: In a city divided by workers and city planners, the son of its mastermind falls for a poor prophet who predicts a mediator who can bring them together.

Long Pants (1927).title: Long Pants
Long Pants (1927).synopsis: After Harry wears new pants, he falls in love with Bebe, a cocaine smuggler. When she is in prison, he decides to save her. Old friend Priscilla waits.

For the Love of Mike (1927).title: For the Love of Mike
For the Love of Mike (1927).synopsis: In Hell's Kitchen, a German delicatessen owner, a Jewish tailor, and an Irish street cleaner adopt a boy named Mike. In 20 years, he defies gamblers.

Wings (1927).title: Wings
Wings (1927).synopsis: Two men are rivals from the same town. While a neighbor becomes an ambulance driver, the two become combat pilots fighting during World War I.

The Jazz Singer (1927).title: The Jazz Singer
The Jazz Singer (1927).synopsis: The son of a Jewish cantor defies the traditions of his religious father as he runs away, changes his name, and dreams of becoming a talented singer.

That Certain Thing (1928).title: That Certain Thing
That Certain Thing (1928).synopsis: Molly Kelly marries restaurant fortune heir Andy, but his father is furious and disinherits them. Andy works digging ditches and later sells lunch boxes.

So This Is Love? (1928).title: So This Is Love?
So This Is Love? (1928).synopsis: Dress designer Jerry begins secretly training as a boxer to take on Spike and earn the affections of store clerk Hilda, who helps by overfeeding Spike.

The Matinee Idol (1928).title: The Matinee Idol
The Matinee Idol (1928).synopsis: Top blackface comedian Don anonymously joins an acting troupe and falls for its lead lady Ginger. Its Civil War melodrama is rough, but he signs it.

Say It with Sables (1928).title: Say It with Sables
Say It with Sables (1928).synopsis: Doug Caswell falls in love with Irene Gordon. She is actually the mistress of his wealthy father John. Doug's stepmother Helen aims to put things right.

Submarine (1928).title: Submarine
Submarine (1928).synopsis: After Jack's wife Bessie leaves to meet his friend Bob, Jack feels betrayed until he feels compelled to rescue Bob in a sunken submarine as a diver.

The Power of the Press (1928).title: The Power of the Press
The Power of the Press (1928).synopsis: Naive newspaper reporter Clem gets a story after he is sent to cover a murder. His main suspect is politician's daughter Jane, who claims innocence.

The Broadway Melody (1929).title: The Broadway Melody
The Broadway Melody (1929).synopsis: A pair of sisters from the vaudeville circuit work to make it big on Broadway, but one sister is courted by both a friend and a member of high society.

The Younger Generation (1929).title: The Younger Generation
The Younger Generation (1929).synopsis: Child of Jewish immigrants Morris Goldfish finds success as an art dealer. He moves his people to Fifth Avenue. He thinks his family hurts his status.

The Donovan Affair (1929).title: The Donovan Affair
The Donovan Affair (1929).synopsis: When lights go out at a party, Jack dies. Inspector Killian requests a re-enactment, but yet another person dies. A second re-enactment is requested.

The Cocoanuts (1929).title: The Cocoanuts
The Cocoanuts (1929).synopsis: During the Florida land boom, the Marx Brothers run a hotel, auction off land, and prevent a jewel robbery, while a wealthy girl falls for an architect.

Nosferatu: A Symphony of Horror (1929).title: Nosferatu: A Symphony of Horror
Nosferatu: A Symphony of Horror (1929).synopsis: In 1838 Germany, the evil vampire Count Orlok expresses interest in a new residence and real estate agent Thomas Hutter's young wife Ellen.

Flight (1929).title: Flight
Flight (1929).synopsis: Former college football player Lefty and his flight school mentor Panama fall for the same beautiful nurse. The two Marines take on attacking bandits.

Anna Christie (1930).title: Anna Christie
Anna Christie (1930).synopsis: A 20-year-old woman reunites with her estranged father and falls in love with a sailor, but hesitates to tell them about her shameful past at a brothel.

Ladies of Leisure (1930).title: Ladies of Leisure
Ladies of Leisure (1930).synopsis: Aspiring artist and tycoon's son Jerry hires Kay, a party girl with a poor past, as a model, but Jerry's parents bring objections and push her to depart.

All Quiet on the Western Front (1930).title: All Quiet on the Western Front
All Quiet on the Western Front (1930).synopsis: German schoolboys, talked into enlisting in World War I by their teacher, find their enthusiasm wane as they get firsthand views of the tragedy of war.

Rain or Shine (1930).title: Rain or Shine
Rain or Shine (1930).synopsis: Mary inherits the struggling Rainey Circus and is aided endlessly by manager Smiley. After workers stage a strike, Smiley performs a one-man circus.

Romance (1930).title: Romance
Romance (1930).synopsis: An Italian opera star kept by a rich older man falls in love with a young clergyman, but their different social class makes engagement untenable.

Animal Crackers (1930).title: Animal Crackers
Animal Crackers (1930).synopsis: On Long Island, mayhem ensues when a painting goes missing during a party for African explorer Captain Spaulding. People create perfect copies.

Cimarron (1931).title: Cimarron
Cimarron (1931).synopsis: In 1889, a land rush pushes a newspaper editor and his young bride to move to Oklahoma. They hope to set up a ranch, but their plans are foiled.

Dracula (1931).title: Dracula
Dracula (1931).synopsis: After a real estate agent succumbs to the will of a vampire, the two head to London where the count sleeps by day and searches for victims by night.

Dirigible (1931).title: Dirigible
Dirigible (1931).synopsis: Commander Jack and Navy pilot Frisky fight over the glory associated with reaching the South Pole and the love of Helen, Frisky's letter-writing wife.

The Public Enemy (1931).title: The Public Enemy
The Public Enemy (1931).synopsis: Two young Chicago hoodlums rise from poverty to become petty thieves and cold-blooded killers. One tries to remain connected to his family.

The Miracle Woman (1931).title: The Miracle Woman
The Miracle Woman (1931).synopsis: After an unappreciated minister dies, his daughter Florence loses her faith in God and opens a fake temple with a con man. She meets a blind aviator.

Monkey Business (1931).title: Monkey Business
Monkey Business (1931).synopsis: On a transatlantic crossing, the stowaway Marx Brothers get up to antics avoiding naval officers, stealing passports, and irritating almost everyone.

Platinum Blonde (1931).title: Platinum Blonde
Platinum Blonde (1931).synopsis: A journalist marries a socialite family's daughter, but each thinks the other's lifestyle must change. Stressed by change, he falls for his best friend.

Frankenstein (1931).title: Frankenstein
Frankenstein (1931).synopsis: Mad scientist Henry and his hunchback assistant Fritz create a human monster out of lifeless body parts. It starts innocent and naive, but it escapes.

Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde (1931).title: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde (1931).synopsis: In London, Henry, who loves his fiancé, imbibes a potion that transforms him into a violent man who abuses a bar singer. He switches back and forth.

Forbidden (1932).title: Forbidden
Forbidden (1932).synopsis: During a cruise to Havana, librarian Lulu falls for married lawyer Bob. As he grows as a politician, she becomes pregnant and works for reporter Al.

Scarface (1932).title: Scarface
Scarface (1932).synopsis: In 1920s Chicago, an ambitious and violent Italian gangster climbs the ladder of success in the mob, but his weaknesses prove to be his downfall.

American Madness (1932).title: American Madness
American Madness (1932).synopsis: Banker Tom is troubled after three gangsters steal from his bank, gossip creates a bank run, and his wife might be having an affair with his top cashier.

Horse Feathers (1932).title: Horse Feathers
Horse Feathers (1932).synopsis: The new president of Huxley College accidentally hires bumblers Baravelli and Pinky to help his school win a football game against rival Darwin.

The Mummy (1932).title: The Mummy
The Mummy (1932).synopsis: An ancient Egyptian priest is revived when an archaeologist on an expedition finds his mummy and accidentally reads an ancient life-giving spell.

The Bitter Tea of General Yen (1933).title: The Bitter Tea of General Yen
The Bitter Tea of General Yen (1933).synopsis: In 1920s Shanghai, missionary Megan is rescued by a Chinese warlord who takes her to his palace. The two fall in love as his concubine betrays him.

King Kong (1933).title: King Kong
King Kong (1933).synopsis: A film crew goes to a tropical island for an exotic location shoot and discovers a colossal ape who takes a shine to their female blonde star.

Morning Glory (1933).title: Morning Glory
Morning Glory (1933).synopsis: When a naively innocent, aspiring actress arrives on the Broadway scene, she is taken under the wing of theater veterans who lead her to success.

Lady for a Day (1933).title: Lady for a Day
Lady for a Day (1933).synopsis: In New York, aging fruit seller Apple Annie, long separated from her daughter, has lied in letters of her aristocracy. A gangster helps her act ladylike.

The Private Life of Henry VIII (1933).title: The Private Life of Henry VIII
The Private Life of Henry VIII (1933).synopsis: In 1536, a king's wife Anne is executed. His third wife dies in childbirth, his fourth sneakily divorces him, his fifth loves a courtier, and his last is bossy.

The Invisible Man (1933).title: The Invisible Man
The Invisible Man (1933).synopsis: Doctor Jack Griffin is covered in bandages and his eyes are hidden, the result of an experiment that made him invisible and murderously insane.

Little Women (1933).title: Little Women
Little Women (1933).synopsis: In 1860s Massachusetts, the four March sisters and their mother confront growing pains, financial shortages, family tragedy, and romantic rivalries.

Duck Soup (1933).title: Duck Soup
Duck Soup (1933).synopsis: Rufus T. Firefly is named president of bankrupt Freedonia and declares war on neighboring rival Sylvania over the love of wealthy Mrs. Teasdale.

Son of Kong (1933).title: Son of Kong
Son of Kong (1933).synopsis: Filmmaker Carl Denham returns to Skull Island to find treasure. He bandages the injured finger of a large but kind albino gorilla he names Little Kong.

It Happened One Night (1934).title: It Happened One Night
It Happened One Night (1934).synopsis: Pampered socialite Ellie runs away from family to New York and is helped by Peter, an unemployed reporter in need of a story. The couple fall in love.

The Thin Man (1934).title: The Thin Man
The Thin Man (1934).synopsis: Former detective Nick Charles and his wealthy wife Nora investigate a case of a a missing man and a murdered secretary, mostly for the fun of it.

Broadway Bill (1934).title: Broadway Bill
Broadway Bill (1934).synopsis: Dan leaves a job at his father-in-law's factory so he can race his thoroughbred horse Bill. Alice, his wife's giving sister, helps him achieve his dreams.

Bride of Frankenstein (1935).title: Bride of Frankenstein
Bride of Frankenstein (1935).synopsis: Mary Shelley reveals the main characters of her novel survived: Dr. Frankenstein, goaded by an even madder scientist, builds his monster a mate.

The Informer (1935).title: The Informer
The Informer (1935).synopsis: In 1922 Dublin, Gypo has been kicked out of the outlaw IRA. When he sees his girlfriend destitute, he betrays his ex-comrade for a 20 pound reward.

Werewolf of London (1935).title: Werewolf of London
Werewolf of London (1935).synopsis: After botanist Wilfred goes to Tibet to look for the mariphasa plant, he returns to a London haunted by murders committed by depraved werewolves.

The 39 Steps (1935).title: The 39 Steps
The 39 Steps (1935).synopsis: After a counter-espionage agent is killed in London, a man must go on the run and stop a spy ring trying to steal top secret information.

Top Hat (1935).title: Top Hat
Top Hat (1935).synopsis: American tap dancer Jerry comes to London and falls for model Dale, whom he initially annoyed. She mistakes him for his goofy, married producer.

A Night at the Opera (1935).title: A Night at the Opera
A Night at the Opera (1935).synopsis: In Milan, a sly business manager and two wacky friends of two opera singers help them achieve success while humiliating their snobbish enemies.

Captain Blood (1935).title: Captain Blood
Captain Blood (1935).synopsis: An Irish doctor is exiled as a governor's slave in Jamaica, where he captures a Spanish galleon and becomes a famous pirate in the Caribbean.

Modern Times (1936).title: Modern Times
Modern Times (1936).synopsis: A little tramp copes with the mechanized world as a factory assembly line worker. He meets orphan girl Ellen. The two struggle to run away together.

The Great Ziegfeld (1936).title: The Great Ziegfeld
The Great Ziegfeld (1936).synopsis: Starting by promoting single performers, Ziegfeld establishes revues featuring dozens of women, developing into his Ziegfeld Follies on Broadway.

Mr. Deeds Goes to Town (1936).title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
Mr. Deeds Goes to Town (1936).synopsis: In Vermont, Longfellow Deeds inherits $20 million from his deceased uncle. He is pressed by those who wish to exploit him. A sanity hearing is held.

Secret Agent (1936).title: Secret Agent
Secret Agent (1936).synopsis: In 1916 during World War I, three British agents are asked to assassinate a mysterious German spy, but two have conflicts with their consciences.

Swing Time (1936).title: Swing Time
Swing Time (1936).synopsis: A roguish gambler and dancer is challenged by his fiancé's father to earn $25,000 to prove his worth, but he falls in love with a dance instructor.

My Man Godfrey (1936).title: My Man Godfrey
My Man Godfrey (1936).synopsis: A scatterbrained socialite with a spoiled big sister hires a forgotten vagrant as a family butler, but he is actually an elite man who considered suicide.

Dodsworth (1936).title: Dodsworth
Dodsworth (1936).synopsis: A retired auto manufacturer and his wife begin a long-planned European vacation only to drift apart befriending and falling for a divorcee and a baron.

After the Thin Man (1936).title: After the Thin Man
After the Thin Man (1936).synopsis: In his home in San Francisco on New Year's Eve, Nick investigates the case of a missing man and later a murder that is connected to Nora's family.

The Good Earth (1937).title: The Good Earth
The Good Earth (1937).synopsis: In China, though farmer Wang Lung and his wife O-Lan initially experience success, their lives are complicated by declining fortunes and lean times.

A Star Is Born (1937).title: A Star Is Born
A Star Is Born (1937).synopsis: Farmgirl Esther goes to Hollywood and achieves dreams of stardom with support from Norman, an alcoholic leading man whose own career falters.

Shall We Dance (1937).title: Shall We Dance
Shall We Dance (1937).synopsis: A ballet star boards the same ship as the dancer and musical star he has fallen for. They fake a marriage for publicity purposes, then fall in love.

Captains Courageous (1937).title: Captains Courageous
Captains Courageous (1937).synopsis: A spoiled brat falls overboard from a steamship. He gets picked up by a fishing schooner, where he works with a fisherman crew for three months.

A Day at the Races (1937).title: A Day at the Races
A Day at the Races (1937).synopsis: A sanitarium owner, a veterinarian pretending to be a doctor, and a racehorse owner struggle to pay for a sanitarium to prevent a banker buying it.

Lost Horizon (1937).title: Lost Horizon
Lost Horizon (1937).synopsis: In 1935, when a wise diplomat's plane crashes in Tibet, he and the survivors are led to Shangri-La, where they deal with the naming of a successor.

Heidi (1937).title: Heidi
Heidi (1937).synopsis: A plucky orphan gets dumped abruptly into her gruff, hermit grandfather's care. She gets retaken and delivered as a companion for a disabled girl.

Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937).title: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937).synopsis: Exiled into the dangerous forest by her wicked stepmother, a princess is rescued by seven dwarf miners who make her part of their household.

Bringing Up Baby (1938).title: Bringing Up Baby
Bringing Up Baby (1938).synopsis: While trying to secure a donation for his museum, a befuddled paleontologist is pursued by a flighty, often irritating heiress and her pet leopard Baby.

The Adventures of Robin Hood (1938).title: The Adventures of Robin Hood
The Adventures of Robin Hood (1938).synopsis: When Prince John and lords begin oppressing the masses in King Richard's absence, a Saxon lord fights back as the outlaw leader of a rebel army.

Alexander's Ragtime Band (1938).title: Alexander's Ragtime Band
Alexander's Ragtime Band (1938).synopsis: In 1915 San Francisco, Roger organizes a jazz band that attains success. He falls in love with his singer Stella but thwarts her efforts to be a star.

Four Daughters (1938).title: Four Daughters
Four Daughters (1938).synopsis: Widowed flute player Adam Lemp and his musical daughters live happily together, but a composer injects himself into the daughters' romantic lives.

You Can't Take It with You (1938).title: You Can't Take It with You
You Can't Take It with You (1938).synopsis: Tony, a banker's son from a family of rich snobs, becomes engaged to Alice, a stenographer from an eccentric family that refuses to sell its house.

Boys Town (1938).title: Boys Town
Boys Town (1938).synopsis: When a death row prisoner tells him he would not have led a life of crime if he had had one friend, Father Flanagan decides to start a home for boys.

The Lady Vanishes (1938).title: The Lady Vanishes
The Lady Vanishes (1938).synopsis: While travelling in continental Europe, a wealthy young playgirl realizes that an elderly governess seems to have disappeared from the train.

Angels with Dirty Faces (1938).title: Angels with Dirty Faces
Angels with Dirty Faces (1938).synopsis: Arrested young, Rocky becomes a gangster. His friend Jerry becomes a Catholic priest who tries to protect street kids from Rocky's bad influence.

A Christmas Carol (1938).title: A Christmas Carol
A Christmas Carol (1938).synopsis: In 1800s London, miser Ebenezer Scrooge has a change of heart after three spirits whisk him into the past, present, and future on a Christmas Eve.

Son of Frankenstein (1939).title: Son of Frankenstein
Son of Frankenstein (1939).synopsis: The son of Dr. Frankenstein meets a hunchback hiding the comatose creature. To clear his family name, he revives and tries to refresh the monster.

Gunga Din (1939).title: Gunga Din
Gunga Din (1939).synopsis: In 1800s India, three British soldiers and a native waterbearer must stop the secret mass revival of the murderous Thuggee cult before it can attack.

Stagecoach (1939).title: Stagecoach
Stagecoach (1939).synopsis: In 1880, a group of people traveling on a coach to New Mexico find their long journey threatened by Geronimo and his Apaches and meet each other.

The Hound of the Baskervilles (1939).title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
The Hound of the Baskervilles (1939).synopsis: Sherlock Holmes investigates the dark legend of a demonic dog that may be stalking the heir on the fog-shrouded land that makes up his estate.

Wuthering Heights (1939).title: Wuthering Heights
Wuthering Heights (1939).synopsis: A traveler is caught in the snow and stays at an estate with cold host Heathcliff. His housekeeper tells the tragic story of the love of him and Cathy.

Young Mr. Lincoln (1939).title: Young Mr. Lincoln
Young Mr. Lincoln (1939).synopsis: Abraham Lincoln is born into a modest log cabin, where he is encouraged by his first love to pursue law. He defends two brothers accused of murder.

The Wizard of Oz (1939).title: The Wizard of Oz
The Wizard of Oz (1939).synopsis: Dorothy is swept away from Kansas to Oz in a tornado and embarks on a quest with new friends to see the Wizard, who can help her return home.

Mr. Smith Goes to Washington (1939).title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
Mr. Smith Goes to Washington (1939).synopsis: The head of the Boy Rangers is appointed to fill a vacancy in the U.S. Senate. His bill to loan money for a boys' camp conflicts with political corruption.

At the Circus (1939).title: At the Circus
At the Circus (1939).synopsis: Circus owner Jeff owes partner Carter $10,000, but Carter's two accomplices steal it. The lawyer Loophole, Tony, and Punchy try to find the money.

Another Thin Man (1939).title: Another Thin Man
Another Thin Man (1939).synopsis: An explosives manufacturer getting death threats suspects a young man is out to kill him. He calls in new parents Nick and Nora to sort things out.

Gone with the Wind (1939).title: Gone with the Wind
Gone with the Wind (1939).synopsis: In the 1860s, Scarlett, the spoiled daughter of a plantation owner, is forced to marry and and lie to get out of poverty. Cynical Rhett proposes to her.

The Shop Around the Corner (1940).title: The Shop Around the Corner
The Shop Around the Corner (1940).synopsis: In Budapest, two employees at a leathergoods shop barely get along, but they fall in love through the post as each other's anonymous letter writer.

His Girl Friday (1940).title: His Girl Friday
His Girl Friday (1940).synopsis: The reporter ex-wife of a newspaper editor is engaged and will be getting remarried the next day. The editor frames her fiancé to stop them.

The Grapes of Wrath (1940).title: The Grapes of Wrath
The Grapes of Wrath (1940).synopsis: In Oklahoma, the poor Joads are forced off their land. They move to California and suffer the pains of the homeless workers in the Great Depression.

Pinocchio (1940).title: Pinocchio
Pinocchio (1940).synopsis: A living wooden puppet built by a lonely toymaker, with the help of a cricket as his conscience, must prove himself worthy to become a real boy.

Rebecca (1940).title: Rebecca
Rebecca (1940).synopsis: A self-conscious woman juggles adjusting to her new role as an aristocrat's wife and avoiding the intimidation of his first spouse's ghostly presence.

Foreign Correspondent (1940).title: Foreign Correspondent
Foreign Correspondent (1940).synopsis: Before World War II, American reporter John tries to expose enemy German agents in London. He witnesses the shooting of an odd Dutch diplomat.

The Great Dictator (1940).title: The Great Dictator
The Great Dictator (1940).synopsis: Ruthless dictator Adenoid Hynkel tries to expand his empire. An amnesiac ex-private Jewish barber tries to avoid persecution with neighbor Hannah.

Fantasia (1940).title: Fantasia
Fantasia (1940).synopsis: Animators present shorts set to music like "Rite of Spring", "The Sorcerer's Apprentice", "Night on Bald Mountain", and "The Nutcracker Suite".

The Letter (1940).title: The Letter
The Letter (1940).synopsis: In Singapore, a plantation manager's wife shoots a man, killing him, and claims self-defense. Her attorney finds an incriminating note written by her.

Tin Pan Alley (1940).title: Tin Pan Alley
Tin Pan Alley (1940).synopsis: Two struggling songwriters team up with singer sisters who help them gain fame. After a betrayal, the sisters depart. The men enlist in World War I.

Go West (1940).title: Go West
Go West (1940).synopsis: A con man and two brothers head west for money and attempt to unite a couple by retrieving a deed taken by a railroad executive and a saloon owner.

The Philadelphia Story (1940).title: The Philadelphia Story
The Philadelphia Story (1940).synopsis: When a rich woman's ex-husband and a reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about her own desires.

Meet John Doe (1941).title: Meet John Doe
Meet John Doe (1941).synopsis: A drifter is recruited by an ambitious columnist to pretend to be a fake man who planned to commit suicide as a protest. A political movement begins.

Citizen Kane (1941).title: Citizen Kane
Citizen Kane (1941).synopsis: After publishing tycoon Charles Foster Kane dies, reporters scramble to understand his complex life and the meaning of his final utterance "Rosebud".

The Big Store (1941).title: The Big Store
The Big Store (1941).synopsis: A detective is hired to protect the life of a singer, who has inherited one half of a department store from his uncle, from the store's crooked manager.

Sergeant York (1941).title: Sergeant York
Sergeant York (1941).synopsis: Tennessee farmer and marksman Alvin is drafted in World War I. He struggles with pacifist beliefs before he becomes a war hero fighting Germany.

The Little Foxes (1941).title: The Little Foxes
The Little Foxes (1941).synopsis: In 1900, Regina manipulates her daughter while she is estranged from a sick husband. She plots a ruthless business deal with her greedy brothers.

The Maltese Falcon (1941).title: The Maltese Falcon
The Maltese Falcon (1941).synopsis: In San Francisco, private detective Sam takes on a case that involves three criminal adventurers, a lying client, and their want of a priceless statuette.

Dumbo (1941).title: Dumbo
Dumbo (1941).synopsis: A young circus elephant born with enormous ears and a supreme lack of confidence learns to surmount all obstacles with the help of a mouse.

How Green Was My Valley (1941).title: How Green Was My Valley
How Green Was My Valley (1941).synopsis: In Wales, the diligent mining family the Morgans raise six sons and hope their youngest Huwe will find a better life but are exploited by mine owners.

Suspicion (1941).title: Suspicion
Suspicion (1941).synopsis: Shy young heiress Lina marries an irresponsible gambler. She begins to suspect he is planning to kill her for life insurance after failed finance plans.

Shadow of the Thin Man (1941).title: Shadow of the Thin Man
Shadow of the Thin Man (1941).synopsis: Nick and Nora's hopes for a calm afternoon at the local racetrack are dashed when a jockey is found shot dead in the locker room. They investigate.

The Wolf Man (1941).title: The Wolf Man
The Wolf Man (1941).synopsis: After his brother’s death, Larry returns home to his father and the family estate. After a trip to a carnival with a woman, he is bitten by a werewolf.

The Ghost of Frankenstein (1942).title: The Ghost of Frankenstein
The Ghost of Frankenstein (1942).synopsis: A monster and Ygor are chased out of town. They encourage the younger son of Dr. Frankenstein to continue experiments and transplant Ygor's brain.

Saboteur (1942).title: Saboteur
Saboteur (1942).synopsis: Aircraft factory worker Barry Kane flees across the United States after he is wrongly accused of starting the fire that killed his best friend.

Yankee Doodle Dandy (1942).title: Yankee Doodle Dandy
Yankee Doodle Dandy (1942).synopsis: From his early days as a child star to the time of his comeback getting a medal, George M. Cohan produces, writes, and performs in musical shows.

Mrs. Miniver (1942).title: Mrs. Miniver
Mrs. Miniver (1942).synopsis: In England, Kay's family lives during World War II. Her son Vin courts a granddaughter and becomes a fighter pilot. Kay dislikes hearing air raid sirens.

The Magnificent Ambersons (1942).title: The Magnificent Ambersons
The Magnificent Ambersons (1942).synopsis: The spoiled heir to a decaying fortune dislikes a man whom his widowed mother rejected yet still loves. He mocks automobiles before their growth.

The Pride of the Yankees (1942).title: The Pride of the Yankees
The Pride of the Yankees (1942).synopsis: Lou Gehrig's mother wants him to be an engineer, but he utilizes his talent for baseball to become a New York Yankees first baseman. He becomes ill.

Holiday Inn (1942).title: Holiday Inn
Holiday Inn (1942).synopsis: At a venue open only on holidays, farmer crooner Jim and dancer Ted vie for the affections of Linda, a beautiful, aspiring performer who sells flowers.

Bambi (1942).title: Bambi
Bambi (1942).synopsis: A buck fawn joins a rabbit and a skunk to explore his forest home. From his doting mother and his father, he learns of the dangers in the meadows.

Road to Morocco (1942).title: Road to Morocco
Road to Morocco (1942).synopsis: Starving Jeff sells best friend Orvill into slavery in a Moroccan marketplace for food. A week later, Jeff learns Orville is now engaged to a princess.

Shadow of a Doubt (1943).title: Shadow of a Doubt
Shadow of a Doubt (1943).synopsis: In Santa Rosa, teenage Charlie, overjoyed when her uncle visits the family, gradually believes he is the Merry Widow Murderer sought by authorities.

Casablanca (1943).title: Casablanca
Casablanca (1943).synopsis: In Morocco, American café owner Rick struggles to decide whether to help his former lover Ilsa and her fugitive husband Victor escape corrupt Nazis.

Saludos Amigos (1943).title: Saludos Amigos
Saludos Amigos (1943).synopsis: Disney animators tour South America and present inspired upbeat shorts "Lake Titicaca", "Pedro", "El Gaucho Goofy", and "Aquarela do Brasil".

Journey into Fear (1943).title: Journey into Fear
Journey into Fear (1943).synopsis: An American ballistics expert is targeted by Nazi agents in Turkey. Safe passage home by ship is arranged, but his pursuers are also on board.

Frankenstein Meets the Wolf Man (1943).title: Frankenstein Meets the Wolf Man
Frankenstein Meets the Wolf Man (1943).synopsis: The resurrected Wolf Man, seeking a cure for his malady, enlists the aid of a mad scientist, who also revives the frozen Frankenstein's monster.

Stormy Weather (1943).title: Stormy Weather
Stormy Weather (1943).synopsis: Great dancer Mr. Bill recounts his past to children. In 1918, he meets singer Selina and promises to return to her. She refuses him after both succeed.

The Song of Bernadette (1943).title: The Song of Bernadette
The Song of Bernadette (1943).synopsis: In 1858, 14-year-old Bernadette experiences 18 visions of the Blessed Virgin Mary. Many believe her sincere. Civil and church leaders confront her.

Lifeboat (1944).title: Lifeboat
Lifeboat (1944).synopsis: Several survivors of a torpedoed merchant ship in World War II find themselves in the same lifeboat with a crew member of the U-boat that sank them.

Ikiru (1956).title: Ikiru
Ikiru (1956).synopsis: A middle-aged man has worked in the same bureaucratic position for decades. Learning he has cancer, he looks for the meaning of his life.

The Man Who Knew Too Much (1956).title: The Man Who Knew Too Much
The Man Who Knew Too Much (1956).synopsis: A couple in Morocco with their son stumble upon a murder plot. When their son is kidnapped to ensure their silence, they try to rescue him.

The Killing (1956).title: The Killing
The Killing (1956).synopsis: A criminal recruits a sharpshooter, a crooked police officer, a bartender, and a betting teller for his last job before going straight and marrying.

The Searchers (1956).title: The Searchers
The Searchers (1956).synopsis: In 1868, a middle-aged Civil War veteran spends years seeking his niece abducted by Comanches, while he is accompanied by his adoptive nephew.

Moby Dick (1956).title: Moby Dick
Moby Dick (1956).synopsis: Ishmael, the sole survivor of a lost whaling ship, relates the story from 1841 of his captain Ahab's self-destructive obsession to hunt a white whale.

The King and I (1956).title: The King and I
The King and I (1956).synopsis: A Welsh widow with a son takes a job as a live-in governess and English teacher to the stubborn King of Siam's children. Their personalities clash.

High Society (1956).title: High Society
High Society (1956).synopsis: A spoiled heiress must choose among three suitors: her jazz musician ex-husband, a stuffy businessman, and an undercover tabloid reporter.

War and Peace (1956).title: War and Peace
War and Peace (1956).synopsis: Napoleon's tumultuous relations with Russia and his disastrous 1812 invasion are the backdrop for the tangled lives of two aristocratic families.

Lust for Life (1956).title: Lust for Life
Lust for Life (1956).synopsis: In France, Dutch painter Vincent Van Gogh is an artistic genius. His obsession with painting, paired with his mental illness, motivates his unhappy life.

The Ten Commandments (1956).title: The Ten Commandments
The Ten Commandments (1956).synopsis: Egyptian prince Moses learns of his true heritage as a Hebrew and his mission as the deliverer of his people against his stubborn pharaoh brother.

Giant (1956).title: Giant
Giant (1956).synopsis: Wealthy Texan rancher Bick marries a Maryland socialite. Their family develops a rivalry with a cowboy, later an oil tycoon, over two generations.

Love Me Tender (1956).title: Love Me Tender
Love Me Tender (1956).synopsis: In the Civil War, a Confederate team is ordered to rob a Union payroll train, but the war ends leaving them with their Union loot. They are hunted down.

Seven Samurai (1956).title: Seven Samurai
Seven Samurai (1956).synopsis: A samurai answers a village’s plea for protection against 40 bandits. He gathers six others to help him teach the people how to defend themselves.

Friendly Persuasion (1956).title: Friendly Persuasion
Friendly Persuasion (1956).synopsis: In 1862 Indiana, a Quaker family is opposed to violence. They struggle in everyday life, but their beliefs are disputed when Civil War troops arrive.

Anastasia (1956).title: Anastasia
Anastasia (1956).synopsis: An businessman tries to pass off a mysterious impostor as the Grand Duchess. She convinces so well that even the biggest skeptics believe her.

The Wrong Man (1956).title: The Wrong Man
The Wrong Man (1956).synopsis: In 1953 New York, Manny is arrested after being mistaken for an armed robber by the police. His wife's resulting depression forces a hospital stay.

Funny Face (1957).title: Funny Face
Funny Face (1957).synopsis: A New York fashion photographer photographs a shy employee at a bookstore. He gets her to join him as a model in France, where they fall in love.

12 Angry Men (1957).title: 12 Angry Men
12 Angry Men (1957).synopsis: A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice against an inner-city teen by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the doubtful evidence.

The Spirit of St. Louis (1957).title: The Spirit of St. Louis
The Spirit of St. Louis (1957).synopsis: Charles "Slim" Lindbergh struggles to finance and design an airplane that will make his New York to Paris flight the first solo transatlantic crossing.

Gunfight at the O.K. Corral (1957).title: Gunfight at the O.K. Corral
Gunfight at the O.K. Corral (1957).synopsis: In 1881 Arizona, marshal Wyatt Earp and outlaw Doc Holliday form an unlikely alliance that ends with their participation in a legendary gunfight.

Love in the Afternoon (1957).title: Love in the Afternoon
Love in the Afternoon (1957).synopsis: A middle-aged playboy becomes fascinated by the daughter of a private detective who has been hired to entrap him with the wife of a client.

An Affair to Remember (1957).title: An Affair to Remember
An Affair to Remember (1957).synopsis: Two engaged strangers have a romance on a cruise from Europe to New York. They agree to reunite at the Empire State Building in six months.

The Curse of Frankenstein (1957).title: The Curse of Frankenstein
The Curse of Frankenstein (1957).synopsis: While awaiting his execution for his maid's death, Baron Victor Frankenstein tells a priest the story of a psychotic creature he made and gave life to.

3:10 to Yuma (1957).title: 3:10 to Yuma
3:10 to Yuma (1957).synopsis: Broke small-time rancher Dan Evans is hired by the stagecoach line to put captured outlaw leader Ben Wade on a train, but a gang tries to free him.

Jailhouse Rock (1957).title: Jailhouse Rock
Jailhouse Rock (1957).synopsis: After he kills a drunk man, Vince is mentored by a cellmate in prison. Once out, he meets a musical promoter, Peggy, who helps him ignite his career.

The Bridge on the River Kwai (1957).title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
The Bridge on the River Kwai (1957).synopsis: In Burma, British prisoners led by a colonel are forced by the Japanese to build a railway bridge across a river, but some Allies plan to destroy it.

Witness for the Prosecution (1957).title: Witness for the Prosecution
Witness for the Prosecution (1957).synopsis: When a man whose alibi depends on his callous wife is arrested for the murder of a rich widow, an ill veteran British barrister agrees to defend him.

Old Yeller (1957).title: Old Yeller
Old Yeller (1957).synopsis: In 1860s Texas, a teenage boy grows to love a stray yellow dog while helping his mother and brother run their homestead and raise cattle.

Paths of Glory (1957).title: Paths of Glory
Paths of Glory (1957).synopsis: After refusing to attack an enemy position, a general accuses the soldiers of cowardice, and their commanding officer must defend them.

South Pacific (1958).title: South Pacific
South Pacific (1958).synopsis: On an island during World War II, love blooms between a young nurse and a Frenchman who is being courted for a dangerous military mission.

Touch of Evil (1958).title: Touch of Evil
Touch of Evil (1958).synopsis: When a car bomb explodes on the Mexico-U.S. border, a Mexican drug enforcement agent investigates with an American police captain.

The Left Handed Gun (1958).title: The Left Handed Gun
The Left Handed Gun (1958).synopsis: After his employer is murdered by rival cattlemen, a troubled and uneducated young cowboy, Billy the Kid, vows violent revenge on the murderers.

Horror of Dracula (1958).title: Horror of Dracula
Horror of Dracula (1958).synopsis: In 1885, Jonathan Harker begins a false job as a librarian in Dracula's castle. Van Helsing plans to destroy Dracula when he targets Harker's friends.

Vertigo (1958).title: Vertigo
Vertigo (1958).synopsis: A former police detective who fears heights is hired to prevent a friend's wife from committing suicide, but he becomes obsessed with her.

Gigi (1958).title: Gigi
Gigi (1958).synopsis: Weary of the conventions of Parisian society, a rich playboy and a youthful courtesan-in-training enjoy a platonic friendship that may not stay so.

The Lone Ranger and the Lost City of Gol.title: The Lone Ranger and the Lost City of Gold
The Lone Ranger and the Lost City of Gol.synopsis: Three Indians are killed wearing medallions that, together, form a treasure map that points to gold. A ranger protects two more medallion owners.

The Bravados (1958).title: The Bravados
The Bravados (1958).synopsis: A rancher follows four outlaws whom he believes killed his wife and finds them in a small town's jail. They escape to Mexico, so he hunts them down.

King Creole (1958).title: King Creole
King Creole (1958).synopsis: A New Orleans teenager flirts with crime before a nightclub owner hears him singing and offers him a job, but a rival mobster tries to lure him back.

The Fly (1958).title: The Fly
The Fly (1958).synopsis: In Montreal, after André is crushed in a hydraulic press, his wife recounts how he swapped matter with a bug in an ill-fated teleportation experiment.

Cat on a Hot Tin Roof (1958).title: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
Cat on a Hot Tin Roof (1958).synopsis: An alcoholic former football player drinks his days away and resists the affections of his wife. A chat with his terminal father jogs revealing memories.

The Blob (1958).title: The Blob
The Blob (1958).synopsis: Teenagers Steve and his girlfriend Jane try to protect their hometown from a gelatinous alien life form that engulfs and kills everything it touches.

The Defiant Ones (1958).title: The Defiant Ones
The Defiant Ones (1958).synopsis: Two escaped prisoners, black Noah and white Joker, are shackled together and become friends cooperating to survive in the American South.

The Seventh Seal (1958).title: The Seventh Seal
The Seventh Seal (1958).synopsis: A knight seeks answers about life, death, and God as he plays chess against the Grim Reaper during the Black Plague. His squire stops a thief.

Bell, Book and Candle (1958).title: Bell, Book and Candle
Bell, Book and Candle (1958).synopsis: The owner of a rare African art store and secret witch likes her publisher neighbor but despises his fiancée so enchants him to love her instead.

A Night to Remember (1958).title: A Night to Remember
A Night to Remember (1958).synopsis: On its 1912 maiden voyage, the luxurious RMS Titanic hits an iceberg in the Atlantic Ocean and sinks. Passengers of all classes strive to survive.

Some Came Running (1958).title: Some Came Running
Some Came Running (1958).synopsis: In 1948, a troubled Army veteran Dave returns to his Midwestern home with his friend Ginny, to the chagrin of his rich, social-climbing brother Frank.

Sleeping Beauty (1959).title: Sleeping Beauty
Sleeping Beauty (1959).synopsis: Maleficent curses Princess Aurora to die on her 16th birthday. Her guardian fairies help her only fall into a sleep that can end with true love's kiss.

House on Haunted Hill (1959).title: House on Haunted Hill
House on Haunted Hill (1959).synopsis: A millionaire offers $10,000 to each of five people who agree to be locked in a house overnight with him and his wife. Two lovers lie and manipulate.

Rio Bravo (1959).title: Rio Bravo
Rio Bravo (1959).synopsis: A Texan sheriff arrests the brother of a powerful rancher for murder. He must hold him with the help of a cripple, a drunk and a young gunfighter.

Some Like It Hot (1959).title: Some Like It Hot
Some Like It Hot (1959).synopsis: After two male musicians witness a mob hit, they flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but one of them wants to win the singer.

Anatomy of a Murder (1959).title: Anatomy of a Murder
Anatomy of a Murder (1959).synopsis: A relaxed Michigan lawyer takes the case of an army lieutenant, claiming insanity, who murdered an innkeeper after his wife claimed he raped her.

North by Northwest (1959).title: North by Northwest
North by Northwest (1959).synopsis: A New York advertising executive goes on the run after being mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies and meets a female agent.

Return of the Fly (1959).title: Return of the Fly
Return of the Fly (1959).synopsis: 15 years after his father's experimentation failed, Philippe and his uncle attempt to create the same device, but one becomes a half-man and half-fly.

A Hole in the Head (1959).title: A Hole in the Head
A Hole in the Head (1959).synopsis: A widower tries to keep a small Miami hotel afloat while raising an 11-year-old son. He is forced to ask for help from his brother, who has conditions.

The Nun's Story (1959).title: The Nun's Story
The Nun's Story (1959).synopsis: A wealthy Belgian surgeon's daughter becomes a nun. She struggles with devotion to her vows after Nazis kill her surgeon father during World War II.

Pillow Talk (1959).title: Pillow Talk
Pillow Talk (1959).synopsis: A songwriter and an interior decorator share a telephone line and despise each other. The man romances the woman with his voice disguised.

Ben-Hur (1959).title: Ben-Hur
Ben-Hur (1959).synopsis: In 26 AD, after Jewish prince Judah is betrayed and sent into slavery by a Roman friend, he gains freedom and returns as a champion charioteer.

Never So Few (1959).title: Never So Few
Never So Few (1959).synopsis: In 1943 Burma, the American OSS mounts covert operations with the native Kachin against Japan. Captain Reynolds abandons notions of protocol.

The Mummy (1959).title: The Mummy
The Mummy (1959).synopsis: In 1895, British archaeologists locate and reopen the tomb of Egyptian Princess Ananka, which is guarded by an undead mummy seeking revenge.

The Apartment (1960).title: The Apartment
The Apartment (1960).synopsis: An insurance clerk tries to rise in his company by letting its executives use his apartment for trysts, but he is attracted to an elevator operator himself.

Psycho (1960).title: Psycho
Psycho (1960).synopsis: Marion steals $40,000 from her work and stays at the Bates Motel, run by Norman, who is controlled by his mother. Her sister Lila later tries to find her.

The Bellboy (1960).title: The Bellboy
The Bellboy (1960).synopsis: Quiet Stanley works at a luxurious Fontainebleau Hotel in Miami Beach. He is a friendly employee, but his clumsiness gives him trouble with guests.

The Little Shop of Horrors (1960).title: The Little Shop of Horrors
The Little Shop of Horrors (1960).synopsis: To avoid being fired by his surly boss, bumbling florist Seymour brings into a shop Audrey Jr., a strange hybrid flower that lives off of human flesh.

Ocean's 11 (1960).title: Ocean's 11
Ocean's 11 (1960).synopsis: Danny Ocean gathers a group of 10 of his World War II compatriots to pull off an elaborate heist of five major Las Vegas casinos on New Year's Eve.

The Time Machine (1960).title: The Time Machine
The Time Machine (1960).synopsis: In 1900 London, George invents a machine. His vision for a utopian society is disillusioned when travelling forward into time reveals a dark society.

Spartacus (1960).title: Spartacus
Spartacus (1960).synopsis: A slave sold to a gladiator trainer turns on his owners and leads the other slaves in rebellion. Their numbers swell as escaped slaves join them.

The Hidden Fortress (1960).title: The Hidden Fortress
The Hidden Fortress (1960).synopsis: In return for gold, two greedy Japanese peasants unknowingly escort a disguised princess and her general across enemy lines during a tribal war.

The Magnificent Seven (1960).title: The Magnificent Seven
The Magnificent Seven (1960).synopsis: Seven gunfighters are hired by Mexican peasants to free their farming village from bandits that raid annually. They train the villagers to fight back.

The Alamo (1960).title: The Alamo
The Alamo (1960).synopsis: In 1836, a small band of soldiers sacrifice their lives in hopeless combat against a massive army to prevent a tyrant general from smashing Texas.

The Virgin Spring (1960).title: The Virgin Spring
The Virgin Spring (1960).synopsis: In Sweden, an innocent virgin and her family's pregnant servant set out to deliver candles to a church, but they encounter savage goat herders.

Swiss Family Robinson (1960).title: Swiss Family Robinson
Swiss Family Robinson (1960).synopsis: A family en route to New Guinea is shipwrecked on a deserted tropical island. They are forced to create a home because pirates surround them.

One Hundred and One Dalmatians (1961).title: One Hundred and One Dalmatians
One Hundred and One Dalmatians (1961).synopsis: When a litter of Dalmatian puppies are abducted by the minions of Cruella de Vil, their parents must find them before she uses them for fashion.

The Misfits (1961).title: The Misfits
The Misfits (1961).synopsis: In Nevada, new divorcee Roslyn falls for an aging cowboy who desires to maintain an independent life. His team rounds up wild mustangs for selling.

The Absent-Minded Professor (1961).title: The Absent-Minded Professor
The Absent-Minded Professor (1961).synopsis: A college professor invents flying rubber, which gains energy every time it strikes a hard surface. It allows shoes to bounce high and a car to fly.

The Parent Trap (1961).title: The Parent Trap
The Parent Trap (1961).synopsis: Two teenage identical twin sisters separated at birth are reunited at a summer camp, where they scheme to swap places to reunite their parents.

The Ladies Man (1961).title: The Ladies Man
The Ladies Man (1961).synopsis: Clueless and recently single graduate Herbert H. Heebert unwittingly takes a job as a servant in a boarding house with young woman inhabitants.

Yojimbo (1961).title: Yojimbo
Yojimbo (1961).synopsis: In 1860, a crafty ronin comes to a small Japanese town divided by two criminal gangs and decides to play them against each other to free the town.

The Hustler (1961).title: The Hustler
The Hustler (1961).synopsis: Fast Eddie Felson, a pool shark with talent but a self-destructive attitude, challenges the legendary player Minnesota Fats to a high-stakes match.

Breakfast at Tiffany's (1961).title: Breakfast at Tiffany's
Breakfast at Tiffany's (1961).synopsis: A New York socialite becomes interested in a young man who has moved into her apartment building, but her past threatens to get in the way.

Splendor in the Grass (1961).title: Splendor in the Grass
Splendor in the Grass (1961).synopsis: In 1928 Kansas, a sensitive teenage girl's love for a young man from a most powerful family drives her to heartbreak and madness in an institution.

West Side Story (1961).title: West Side Story
West Side Story (1961).synopsis: Maria and Tony fall in love, but their friends, New York City gangs the Puerto Rican Sharks and the white Jets, plan a tragic rumble under a highway.

Babes in Toyland (1961).title: Babes in Toyland
Babes in Toyland (1961).synopsis: Mary Contrary and Tom Piper are about to marry, but villainous Barnaby has his goons kidnap Tom and Mary's sheep so he can marry her for money.

The Innocents (1961).title: The Innocents
The Innocents (1961).synopsis: At Bly, governess Miss Giddens takes care of two orphans that show weird behavior. She thinks the house is haunted by ghosts and possessed kids.

Pocketful of Miracles (1961).title: Pocketful of Miracles
Pocketful of Miracles (1961).synopsis: New York gangster Dave the Dude and girlfriend Queenie try to turn street beggar Apple Annie to a lady to impress her daughter marrying a rich man.

The Children's Hour (1961).title: The Children's Hour
The Children's Hour (1961).synopsis: Two former college classmates run a young girls' private school. When a spoiled student accuses them of lesbianism, they fight libel and slander.

Sergeants 3 (1962).title: Sergeants 3
Sergeants 3 (1962).synopsis: In 1870, Mike, Chip, and Larry are cavalry officers who join black trumpeter Jonah to thwart a Native American chief who plans to unite multiple tribes.

Cape Fear (1962).title: Cape Fear
Cape Fear (1962).synopsis: In Georgia, after spending eight years in prison for rape, Max Cady stalks a lawyer he blames for his conviction, his wife, and his teenage daughter.

The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance (1962).title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance (1962).synopsis: 25 years later, a senator, who became famous for killing a notorious outlaw, returns for the funeral of an old friend and tells the truth about his deed.

Lolita (1962).title: Lolita
Lolita (1962).synopsis: A middle-aged British novelist becomes obsessed with the teenage daughter of the woman who runs the boarding house he comes to stay at.

The Music Man (1962).title: The Music Man
The Music Man (1962).synopsis: In 1912, con man Harold Hill comes to River City, Iowa with a scam using a boy’s marching band program, but a kind librarian tries to discredit him.

The Phantom of the Opera (1962).title: The Phantom of the Opera
The Phantom of the Opera (1962).synopsis: In 1900, an acid-scarred composer has his dwarf helper bring a young opera singer to his London sewer hideout so he can groom her to play a part.

The Longest Day (1962).title: The Longest Day
The Longest Day (1962).synopsis: On June 6th, 1944, U.S., French, German, and British soldiers experience the D-Day landings at Normandy. Allies invade while Axis forces defend.

The Manchurian Candidate (1962).title: The Manchurian Candidate
The Manchurian Candidate (1962).synopsis: A Korean War veteran, part of a political family, is brainwashed to be an assassin by communists after his platoon is taken. He targets a nominee.

What Ever Happened to Baby Jane? (1962).title: What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?
What Ever Happened to Baby Jane? (1962).synopsis: Jane Hudson, a successful child star, cares for her crippled sister, whose career in later years eclipsed her own, in an old Hollywood mansion.

Lawrence of Arabia (1962).title: Lawrence of Arabia
Lawrence of Arabia (1962).synopsis: During World War I, a British lieutenant aids Arab tribes in their revolt against the Ottoman Empire. He evolves into a messianic figure for Arab unity.

To Kill a Mockingbird (1962).title: To Kill a Mockingbird
To Kill a Mockingbird (1962).synopsis: In 1930s Alabama, lawyer Atticus defends a black man against a false rape charge. His two children Jem and Scout search for neighbor Boo Radley.

How the West Was Won (1963).title: How the West Was Won
How the West Was Won (1963).synopsis: From 1839 to 1889, the Prescott family participate in Westward expansion, going through the Gold Rush, the Civil War, and the building of railroads.

The Birds (1963).title: The Birds
The Birds (1963).synopsis: Socialite Melanie follows lawyer Mitch to Bodega Bay with lovebirds, but fowl of all kinds suddenly begin to attack people. Melanie hides in a house.

Bye Bye Birdie (1963).title: Bye Bye Birdie
Bye Bye Birdie (1963).synopsis: A rock singer travels to an Ohio town to make his farewell performance and kiss a fan before the draft. A songwriter wants him to sing his tune.

Sanjuro (1963).title: Sanjuro
Sanjuro (1963).synopsis: A crafty samurai helps a young man and his clansmen save his uncle, who has been framed and imprisoned by a corrupt superintendent.

Dr. No (1963).title: Dr. No
Dr. No (1963).synopsis: Bond visits Jamaica to investigate a colleague's murder and the radio disruption of the U.S. space program by a scientific genius with his own island.

The Nutty Professor (1963).title: The Nutty Professor
The Nutty Professor (1963).synopsis: To improve his social life, nerdish professor Julius Kelp drinks a potion that temporarily turns him into the handsome, but obnoxious, Buddy Love.

Cleopatra (1963).title: Cleopatra
Cleopatra (1963).synopsis: Starting in 48 B.C., a queen of Egypt manipulates both leaders Julius Caesar and Mark Antony in her ill-fated attempt to save the Egyptian empire.

Jason and the Argonauts (1963).title: Jason and the Argonauts
Jason and the Argonauts (1963).synopsis: Jason goes to Thessaly to claim his fated throne. With an Argonaut crew and the help of Hera, he sets out on a voyage to seek the Golden Fleece.

The Great Escape (1963).title: The Great Escape
The Great Escape (1963).synopsis: Imprisoned during World War II in a German prisoner-of-war camp, Allied soldiers intend to break out to escape and draw Nazi forces away.

Stray Dog (1963).title: Stray Dog
Stray Dog (1963).synopsis: During a sweltering summer in Tokyo, a rookie homicide detective with a veteran as a partner tries to locate his Colt pistol stolen by a criminal.

The Haunting (1963).title: The Haunting
The Haunting (1963).synopsis: For 90 years, Hill House's inhabitants have met tragic ends. A doctor assembles a team whom he believes can prove whether the house is haunted.

Lilies of the Field (1963).title: Lilies of the Field
Lilies of the Field (1963).synopsis: When traveling black handyman Homer stops by an Arizona farm, he is welcomed by nuns who believe God sent him to help build them a chapel.

Johnny Cool (1963).title: Johnny Cool
Johnny Cool (1963).synopsis: Johnny Colini, an exiled American living in Rome, rescues a Sicilian fugitive from the police. He is trained and renamed before a mission of revenge.

It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World (1963).title: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World
It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World (1963).synopsis: In a California desert, five motorists observe a car crash. When the driver's dying words indicate the location of a secret stash of loot, they race to win.

McLintock! (1963).title: McLintock!
McLintock! (1963).synopsis: An aging rancher uses influence to keep peace in the territory. He deals with the return of his wife seeking divorce and his newly engaged daughter.

The Incredible Journey (1963).title: The Incredible Journey
The Incredible Journey (1963).synopsis: Three pets, a cat and two dogs, lose their owners when they are all on vacation. They try to find their way home through forests and mountains.

High and Low (1963).title: High and Low
High and Low (1963).synopsis: In Japan, an executive struggling to gain control of a shoe company receives threats when his chauffeur's son is kidnapped and held for ransom.

Charade (1963).title: Charade
Charade (1963).synopsis: After her husband's murder, Regina is chased in Paris by three men wanting money he stole. She turns to a charming American stranger for help.

4 for Texas (1963).title: 4 for Texas
4 for Texas (1963).synopsis: Sharpshooters Zack and Joe are in a stagecoach and manage to fight off Matson's robber gang, so then fight over the $100,000 carried by an official.

Captain Newman, M.D. (1963).title: Captain Newman, M.D.
Captain Newman, M.D. (1963).synopsis: In 1944 Yuma, Army doctor Josiah is in charge of a neuropsychiatric ward at Colfax Army Air Field's military hospital. He deals with struggling patients.

The Sword in the Stone (1963).title: The Sword in the Stone
The Sword in the Stone (1963).synopsis: A poor boy named Arthur learns the power of love, knowledge, and bravery with the help of the wizard Merlin in the path to become a king.

Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Sto.title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Sto.synopsis: An unbalanced general sends his bomber wing to destroy the USSR, a move the War Room full of politicians and generals frantically tries to prevent.

Becket (1964).title: Becket
Becket (1964).synopsis: King Henry II of England comes to terms with his affection for his close Saxon friend and confidant, who finds true honor observing God's divine will.

The Pink Panther (1964).title: The Pink Panther
The Pink Panther (1964).synopsis: The bumbling Inspector Clouseau travels to Rome to catch a notorious jewel thief known as the Phantom before he steals a large diamond.

The Incredible Mr. Limpet (1964).title: The Incredible Mr. Limpet
The Incredible Mr. Limpet (1964).synopsis: In 1941, shy bookkeeper Henry Limpet turns into a talking fish and helps the U.S. Navy locate and hit Nazi submarines with help from a hermit crab.

Paris When It Sizzles (1964).title: Paris When It Sizzles
Paris When It Sizzles (1964).synopsis: Gabrielle, the sprightly assistant of the Hollywood screenwriter Richard helps him over his writer's block by acting out his fantasies of possible plots.

The Last Man on Earth (1964).title: The Last Man on Earth
The Last Man on Earth (1964).synopsis: When a disease turns almost all humans into the living dead, the lone healthy survivor Robert kills vampires during the day and stays home at night.

Viva Las Vegas (1964).title: Viva Las Vegas
Viva Las Vegas (1964).synopsis: A race car driver preparing for the Grand Prix wiles his time in Las Vegas as a waiter to pay for his new engine. He falls for a beautiful woman.

From Russia with Love (1964).title: From Russia with Love
From Russia with Love (1964).synopsis: SPECTRE operatives exploit a Soviet cipher clerk to lure Bond to help them get a decoding device. He meets her in Istanbul, where he must escape.

A Shot in the Dark (1964).title: A Shot in the Dark
A Shot in the Dark (1964).synopsis: Inspector Clouseau investigates the murder of a politically influential industrial tycoon's chauffeur at a country estate. A maid is the main suspect.

Robin and the 7 Hoods (1964).title: Robin and the 7 Hoods
Robin and the 7 Hoods (1964).synopsis: In 1920s Chicago, Guy betrays boss Big Jim. His ally Robbo forms a team and becomes a criminal who robs from the rich and then gives to the poor.

Marnie (1964).title: Marnie
Marnie (1964).synopsis: In Philadelphia, a rich widower marries a habitual thief who fears thunderstorms and is repulsed by intimacy, and tries to help her resolve her issues.

A Hard Day's Night (1964).title: A Hard Day's Night
A Hard Day's Night (1964).synopsis: The young Beatles struggle to keep themselves and Paul's mischievous grandfather in check while preparing for a live television performance.

Mary Poppins (1964).title: Mary Poppins
Mary Poppins (1964).synopsis: In 1910 London, a magical nanny employs music and adventure to help ignored Jane and Michael become closer to their preoccupied banker father.

Godzilla vs. the Thing (1964).title: Godzilla vs. the Thing
Godzilla vs. the Thing (1964).synopsis: A typhoon washes ashore a gigantic egg claimed by greedy entrepreneurs who refuse to return it to Mothra, as Godzilla washes ashore as well.

Cheyenne Autumn (1964).title: Cheyenne Autumn
Cheyenne Autumn (1964).synopsis: In 1878, the Cheyenne, tired of broken promises by the government, head for their ancestral lands, but a cavalry officer is asked to bring them back.

My Fair Lady (1964).title: My Fair Lady
My Fair Lady (1964).synopsis: A snobbish phonetics professor agrees to a bet that he can make a Cockney flower girl pass for a cultured woman. He grants her speech lessons.

Goldfinger (1964).title: Goldfinger
Goldfinger (1964).synopsis: A gold magnate initiates Operation Grand Slam, a scheme to raid Fort Knox and ruin the economy. With an Aston Martin DB5, Bond stops the plan.

The Curse of the Mummy's Tomb (1964).title: The Curse of the Mummy's Tomb
The Curse of the Mummy's Tomb (1964).synopsis: In 1900, when archaeologists and one American investor ship an Egyptian mummy's sarcophagus to London, a magical amulet revives the mummy.

The Sound of Music (1965).title: The Sound of Music
The Sound of Music (1965).synopsis: In 1938 Austria, nun Maria becomes a governess to the seven children of a widowed naval captain, bringing all of them a new love of life and music.

Major Dundee (1965).title: Major Dundee

The Sons of Katie Elder (1965).synopsis: A beloved ranch owner has four sons: a gunman, a gambler, a student, and a hardware dealer, who decide at her funeral to live to her expectations.

Dracula: Prince of Darkness (1966).synopsis: Two couples traveling in Europe decide to head to Karlsbad dire local warnings. Dracula comes back to life, stalking all four of his castle's new visitors.

Torn Curtain (1966).title: Torn Curtain

Batman (1966).title: Batman

Fahrenheit 451 (1966).title: Fahrenheit 451

A Fistful of Dollars (1967).synopsis: A wandering gunfighter enters a Mexican village and plays two rival families against each other in a town torn apart by greed, pride, and revenge.

Bonnie and Clyde (1967).title: Bonnie and Clyde

Clambake (1967).title: Clambake

Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid (1969.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid (1969.synopsis: In 1899 Wyoming, two partners lead a band of outlaws. After a train robbery goes wrong, the two go on the run to Bolivia while chased by a posse.

The Sterile Cuckoo (1969).synopsis: Two college freshmen, quirky oddball Pookie and reserved Jerry, meet on a bus and start seeing each other. The two's differences pull them apart.

The Computer Wore Tennis Shoes (1969).title: The Computer Wore Tennis Shoes

M*A*S*H (1970).title: M*A*S*H

Chisum (1970).title: Chisum

Five Easy Pieces (1970).title: Five Easy Pieces

The Great White Hope (1970).title: The Great White Hope

Scars of Dracula (1970).title: Scars of Dracula

THX 1138 (1971).title: THX 1138

The Beguiled (1971).title: The Beguiled

The Abominable Dr. Phibes (1971).title: The Abominable Dr. Phibes
The Abominable Dr. Phibes (1971).synopsis: A disfigured organist seeks vengeance on doctors he blames for his wife's death. He murders them taking inspiration from the Ten Plagues of Egypt.

Escape from the Planet of the Apes (1971.title: Escape from the Planet of the Apes
Escape from the Planet of the Apes (1971.synopsis: Three talking chimpanzees arrive mysteriously in a U.S. spacecraft. They celebrities, but one man believes them to be a threat to the human race.

Big Jake (1971).title: Big Jake

Drive, He Said (1971).title: Drive, He Said

Klute (1971).title: Klute

Shaft (1971).title: Shaft
Shaft (1971).synopsis: Cool black private detective John Shaft is hired by a crime lord to find and retrieve his kidnapped daughter.

Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory (197.title: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory (197.synopsis: A poor but hopeful boy seeks one of the five coveted golden tickets that will send him on a tour of Willy Wonka's mysterious chocolate factory.

The French Connection (1971).title: The French Connection

Bedknobs and Broomsticks (1971).title: Bedknobs and Broomsticks

Diamonds Are Forever (1971).synopsis: Bond infiltrates Las Vegas diamond smuggling to foil Blofeld's plot to target Washington, D.C. with a laser in space. Smuggler Tiffany captivates him.

A Clockwork Orange (1971).synopsis: In future England, a sadistic gang leader is jailed for murder. He volunteers for a conduct aversion experiment and is conditioned to abhor violence.

Dirty Harry (1971).title: Dirty Harry
